Heap vs Stack

1 A Heap is the memory address place assigned to a thread, where it can store all local and temporary variables.

  • Follows the LIFO(Last In First Out) principle
  • Grows and shrinks in size with the program

  • Doesnâ€™t require any kind of garbage collection

  • A Stack is the memory address place assigned to a process and all its threads, to store objects, classes and instance variables.
  • Pointers are used for refferencing
  • A garbage collector MUST be enforced
  • Slow access time
